question_text: Which of the following statements about magnet poles is correct?
options: A. Like poles attract each other.
B. Unlike poles repel each other.
C. Like poles repel each other while unlike poles attract each other.
D. Both like and unlike poles always repel each other.
correct_answer: C. Like poles repel each other while unlike poles attract each other.
explanation: By definition, like poles (North-North or South-South) repel and unlike poles (North-South) attract. This fundamental property of magnetism demonstrates non-contact magnetic forces.
